answerText: convective instability [or convection or other word forms][10] In stars heavier than about two solar masses, convection occurs in this part of the star, due to its high specific power generation. Type II supernovae occur when this structure becomes enriched in iron and nickel and then collapses.
heading: ACF Regionals |2014 | Chicago A, Columbia A, and VCU | 15 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this type of instability, in which buoyant forces act to increase the vertical displacement of a fluid. Unlike absolute instabilities, this type of instability transports a perturbation to infinity.
